info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 12:58PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Luzerne County through 130 PM EDT... At 1258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wilkes-Barre, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilkes-Barre, Pittston, Exeter, Duryea, West Pittston, Dupont, Avoca, Laflin, Hughestown and Yatesville. This includes the following highway exits... Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 168 and 178A and B. Interstate 476 near 115. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
